sub_topic: Analysis of the purity of a substance using melting point determination
message_1: What is the purity of a sample of aspirin if its observed melting point range is 136.5-138.5째C, given the literature melting point of pure aspirin is 138-140째C?
message_2:
It is difficult to determine the exact purity of a sample based solely on its melting point range. However, we can infer that the sample is impure because the observed melting point range (136.5-138.5째C) is lower than the literature melting point range of pure aspirin (138-140째C).

Impurities in a sample typically cause the melting point to decrease and the melting point range to broaden. To determine the exact purity of the sample, other analytical techniques, such as high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) or mass spectrometry, would be required.
